### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE StudentTransactions (
  transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  student_id INT,
  payment_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  fee_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  financial_aid_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  transaction_date TIMESTAMP
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE StudentTransactions SET payment_amount = 500.00 WHERE transaction_id = 1;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE StudentTransactions (
  transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  student_id INT,
  payment_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  fee_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  financial_aid_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),

### STATEMENT

UPDATE StudentTransactions SET payment_amount = payment_amount + 200, fee_amount = fee_amount + 100, financial_aid_amount = financial_aid_amount - 50 WHERE transaction_date > '2022-01-01';

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE student_payments (
  student_id UUID,
  payment_amount DECIMAL,
  payment_date DATE,
  PRIMARY KEY (student_id)
);

CREATE TABLE financial_transactions (
  transaction_id UUID,
  transaction_amount DECIMAL,
  transaction_date DATE,
  transaction_type VARCHAR,
  student_id UUID,
  PRIMARY KEY (transaction_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (student_id) REFERENCES student_payments (student_id)
);

### STATEMENT

UPDATE student_payments SET payment_amount = 500 WHERE student_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
